Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/786a3a2ef42785aa6306779fb9f19037/tumblr_inline_nbgf4wCo7G1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><span>We’re working on putting these in 0.25, but if they can’t make it in, enjoy your preview of a future update!</span></p>

Nuts, I missed the Squadcast, is there a summary anywhere?

The bomb bays cargo bays look great, glad to hear them confirmed.

Edit: I spoke too soon, not confirmed for 0.25, *may* be pushed back: "We're working on putting these in 0.25, but if they can't make it in, enjoy your preview of a future #KSP update!"

Edited September 6, 2014 by Red Iron Crown
Woohoo! I can't wait to use these as bomb bays [2]
I missed it too... They should be cool!

If you are having trouble with them in that complex spaceplane form, you can always try a simple cylinder, and attach the cargo at the bottom. Doesn't even need to open and close, it can be open at the top.
Awe, I really hope they make it into .25. I mean, if they're going to add new spaceplane parts, how could they not add cargo bays?

If they don't make it to .25, will they wait until .26, or could there be a smaller update in between (.25.1 or even .25.5)?

Also, please, please make them for cylindrical rockets too!

If they don't make it to .25, will they wait until .26, or could there be a smaller update in between (.25.1 or even .25.5)?

Also, please, please make them for cylindrical rockets too!

It'd likely be in the following update. As I have it, it's at around a 95% chance of making it into 0.25, given the development schedule right now and adding in some time, lest fires start going off.
Is the issue with firespitter, and if so, can they not just add it in? or is that not porkjets?

I am currently using the SP+ mod and it works fine. I don't have problem when using these cargo bays. I mean open and close them. But I heard people talking about they can't open them. I am not sure why. What really annoying me is when trying to attach cargo to the bay, things get really tricky.
Nice. Cannot wait to see what small things I can fit into it and brake it. =^.^=

Is the issue with firespitter, and if so, can they not just add it in? or is that not porkjets?

It's not Porkjet's, it's from Snjo's Firespitter mod. I suspect the issue is duplicating the functionality of the firespitter.dll, not sure if they've considered licensing it as well (and either way, it will be great for mods as a lot of them depend on the firespitter.dll for animations and other functions). At least Rowsdower sounds optimistic, a 95% chance the bays will be in 0.25 sounds good to me.

Also, please, please make them for cylindrical rockets too!

Cargo bays for rockets? Aren't you asking for fairings here?
Will the sp+ parts be in a separate folder? like the NASA mission parts? they will be easier to remove then (since i will never use them as i don't like SSTOs)
This would be really nice for my shuttles.

Also, please, please make them for cylindrical rockets too!

I'm just hoping the Mk3 parts come with a cargo bay that fit 2.5m parts.

As someone who used the Firespitter.dll on his mod, i can say it gives a lot more functionality to ingame animations like extending antennae, doors, you name it, and ive never had a problem with it. I would heartily recommend the dev team bought that off snjo, or replicated it as closely as they can. I don't think people who download mods using it realize how much of a difference it makes.
Any reason been given as to why they may not be added? Surely all squad want to do is a little retexture?

Any reason been given as to why they may not be added? Surely all squad want to do is a little retexture?

The cargo bays in SP+ depend on another third party .dll to make their animations work properly. There may be difficulties reimplementing or purchasing that .dll's functionality, but that is just speculation on my part.

It's a bit more than a retexture, the cross section of the Mk2 parts has been changed to be symmetrical, which requires new models and textures. I don't think that's the issue though as they've already shown the models/textures in the teaser shots.

The cargo bays in SP+ depend on another third party .dll to make their animations work properly. There may be difficulties reimplementing or purchasing that .dll's functionality, but that is just speculation on my part.

It's a bit more than a retexture, the cross section of the Mk2 parts has been changed to be symmetrical, which requires new models and textures. I don't think that's the issue though as they've already shown the models/textures in the teaser shots.

Oh i see, they use firespitter for anims; and seriously that wouldn't take long considering porkjet had apparently redone most of them before the last devnotes.

Cargo bays for rockets? Aren't you asking for fairings here?

No. Not at all...

Fairings are shells that are ejected once the ship has exited the atmosphere. I'm talking about a hollow cylinder that items can be placed inside, with a door that can be opened and closed to access the things inside. In other words, exactly what's in the image above, only in a 2.5m cylindrical form. Actually, you don't even need the bay doors. I just want something like the unpressurized cargo trunks that nearly all modern spacecraft have.

I"m a little confused. The thread uses the plurals of "these" and "they". We are looking at two different parts there right? One (obviously) the cargo bay with the doors, "That really really work!", and the one on the right, is that a cargo bay with no doors?, or what?

I"m a little confused. The thread uses the plurals of "these" and "they". We are looking at two different parts there right? One (obviously) the cargo bay with the doors, "That really really work!", and the one on the right, is that a cargo bay with no doors?, or what?

There's three parts in the picture. On the left are two small cargo bays, the top one just starting to open and the other fully or almost fully open. On the right is a large bay with the doors fully closed.
I like how we're getting cargo bays in stock now. I hope part of the update (or at least "soon") is a round counterpart we can use on rockets.

@twreed I know you are asking for these in stock, but I wanted to make sure you knew about these: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/61040-0-23-6S-Service-Compartment-Tubes-Design-smooth!?highlight=service+tubes

There is a Module Manager file in the thread that adds double height versions, though they are stackable anyway. I find them extremely useful since getting hooked on FAR.
